docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12--The United States formally recognized General Manuel Avila Camacho as President-elect of Mexico tonight when President Roosevelt designated Henry A. Wallace, Vice President-elect, to represent him at the inauguration in Mexico...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12--The United States formally recognized General Manuel Avila Camacho as President-elect of Mexico tonight when President Roosevelt designated Henry A. Wallace, Vice President-elect, to represent him at the inauguration in Mexico City on December 1.

docs.snippet: THE first series of stamps of Pitcairn Island, a British  Pacific possession populated largely by descendants of the English seamen identified with "the mutiny on the Bounty" late in the eighteenth century, reached New York last week.
